Description:
2015 Kent State University Catalog - Spring 2016 Course Descriptions
(Equivalent to MIS 24053) Covers the basic concepts and use of computer systems, including hardware,
 personal productivity software, Internet usage and file management.

Visual Basic.NET language introducing concepts of object-oriented, event-driven program design and
 implementation.

This overview course will provide an introduction to information technologies, career paths and professional
 certifications available.

Course Name: INTRODUCTION TO OPERATING SYSTEMS AND NETWORKING TECHNOLOGY
Description:
Survey of desktop and network OS essentials, including file and disk management, system tools utilization,
 resource sharing and introductory network concepts.

Focuses on web site technologies including HTML. Students learn the history of the Internet and effective search
 techniques.

Prerequisites: COMT 11005 orCS 33211 or DSCI 26010 or TECH 10001.
Description:
Covers disk operating system functions and features; hardware/software installation procedures; file and
 directories management; system configuration/optimization; backup procedures.

Covers intermediate concepts and integration of computer applications. Emphasis on software suites,
 specifically word processing, electronic spreadsheets, database and presentation applications.

Course using C++ introducing concepts of software development, object-oriented event-driven programming,
 testing and debugging, simple and complex data types language syntax and semantics.

Course using Java introducing concepts of software development, object-oriented event-driven programming,
 testing and debugging, simple and complex data types, language syntax and semantics.

2015 Kent State University Catalog - Spring 2016 Course Descriptions
Introduces networking in LAN and WAN environments. Topics include network protocol, configuration,
 operation, setup, installation, administration, management and security. Pre/corequisite: COMT 11009.

Prerequisites: COMT11002 or CS 13001 or DSCI 15310 or MIS 24065.
Description: Advanced course in the visual basic language focusing on database systems development.

Covers the ethics, issues and policies regarding the Internet. It includes discussion/research on intellectual
 property/freedom, hacking, pornography, privacy, etc.

Course Name: COMPUTER METHODS IN SCIENCE AND ENGINEERING
Description:
Use of computers in problems related to science and engineering. Course will include introduction to elements
 of a high level scientific language.

Capstone course for COMT students encompassing critical reading, writing
and discussion applying the current
 theories of computer technologies to on-the-job experiences. Students will develop a portfolio to confirm their
 level of knowledge.

Research project-oriented course emphasizing workgroup methodologies for
group project management,
 problem definition, data retrieval and analysis, conclusions and recommendations.

Prerequisites: COMT 11006 or COMT faculty special approval.
Description: Focuses on developing and managing effective web sites using multimedia elements including sound and video.

Prerequisites: COMT 11002 and COMT 11006; orCS 13001 and CS 27101; or TECH 2631; or MIS 24065.
Description:
This course will focus on client-side scripting needed to create interactive and dynamic Web sites. The use of
 scripting in context with various technologies will be explored.

(Repeatable for credit) Supervised work experience in information technology environment; 45 hours
 supervised work experience per credit hour.

2015 Kent State University Catalog - Spring 2016 Course Descriptions
(Repeatable for credit)Topics announced when scheduled.
(Repeatable for credit)Individual study in computer field. Open to computer technology majors.

Prerequisites: COMT21002 or CS 33211 or DSCI 26010; or TECH 23010 and TECH 26301.
Description:
Covers local area network troubleshooting techniques. Topics include identifying the scope of the problem,
 systematic troubleshooting approaches, problem resolution and ongoing maintenance.

Prerequisites: COMT 21002 or CS 33211 or DSCI 26010; orTECH 23010 and 26301.
Description:
Introduces internetworking concepts. Topics include networking standards, cabling, TCPIP, router configuration,
 LAN and WAN segments and other related topics.

Prerequisites: COMT 21002 or CS 33211 or DSCI 26010; or TECH 23010 and TECH 26301.
Description:
Tools and techniques ethical hackers and security testers use to discover vulnerabilities and solutions to protect
 computer networks.

(Repeatable for credit)Various special courses will be announced in the schedule of classes under this course
 number with different section numbers.

Course using C++: classes and data abstraction, stream IO, inheritance, standard template library, Microsoft
 Foundation Classes, system programming concepts using Unified Modeling Language..

Introduces concepts of software development, object-oriented event-driven programming, testing and
 debugging, simple and complex data
types, language syntax and semantics.
Course covers various concepts involved in the creation and manipulation of digital images.

Prerequisites: junior standing.2015 Kent State University Catalog - Spring 2016 Course Descriptions
Description:
Introduction to ergonomics, usability design, and assessment methods for
the development of computer
 hardware, software, and systems.

Prerequisites: COMT 11002 or CS 13001 or DSCI 15310 or MIS 24065.
Description:
Introduces the unique program design considerations required by mobile device platforms such as PDAs and
 Smartphones. Practical programming examples will utilize Visual Basic and the .NET Compact Framework.

Course focuses on advanced technologies for Web development, including DHTML, plug-ins, etc. Students will
 learn to create more interactive and
dynamic web sites.

Course using Java abstract data types and objects, object-oriented, event-driven design, file organization and
 access, and systems programming concepts.

Course Name: SEMINAR IN EMERGING COMPUTER AND INFORMATION TECHNOLOGIES
Description: Survey of new and emerging technologies in computer and information technology.

(Repeatable for a maximum of 6 credit hours) Certification preparation course to help students prepare for
 professional certification attempts in Computer Technology. Certification is not guaranteed. Certification fees
 may apply.

Course Name: SURVEY OF INFORMATION SECURITY, INTERNET FRAUD AND COMPUTER FORENSICS
Prerequisites: ENG 21011 or HONR 10297; and junior standing.
Description:
This lecture-based, survey course provides a non-technical introduction to contemporary issues in information
 security, Internet fraud and computer forensics.

Prerequisites: COMT21002 or CS 33211 or DSCI 26010 ;or TECH 23010 and TECH 26301
Description: Hands-on skills in incident response, forensic preparation, and data recovery, and analysis.

Prerequisites: COMT21002 or CS 33211 or DSCI 26010; or TECH 23010 and TECH 26301.
Description:
Emphasizing hands-on skills in live incident response, the proper use of
network forensic tools, network
 monitoring, live data capture, evidence
analysis, data integrity and other related topics.

Prerequisites: COMT 21002 or CS 33211 or DSCI 26010; or TECH 23010 and TECH 26301.
Description:
Examines the primary issues involved in securing resources in a LAN, including threat assessment,
2015 Kent State University Catalog - Spring 2016 Course Descriptions
countermeasures, best practices, security protocols, cryptography and management-related issues.

Reinforcing Internetworking concepts. Topics include network standards, LAN switching, VLANs, network
 designs, routing protocols and configuration, LAN and WAN segments, and other related topics.

Prerequisites: COMT 21036or special approval of COMT faculty.
Description: Focuses on server-side scripting needed to create interactive and dynamic web sites.

Examination of help desks that exist, importance within organizations, the roles and skills required, and
 methods and technologies commonly employed.

Introduces the use of Visual Basic for Applications (VBA) as a tool to create customized programs that automate
 repetitive and/or complex tasks
performed using office suite applications.

Prerequisites: COMT 21002 or CS 33211 or DSCI 26010; or TECH 23010 and TECH 26301.
Description:
Preparing students to perform effectively in Windows, Linux, and various
server command line environments.
 Command syntax, batch files, script files, internal & external commands, and other related topics will be
 covered.

(Repeatable for a maximum of 6 credit hours) An arranged work experience
for students in the IT field.
 Students complete 45 hours of internship per credit.

Prerequisites: COMT 21002; or DSCI 26010; or CS 33211; or TECH 23010 and TECH26301.
Description:
Builds on a background in networking and focuses on cybersecurity best practices, standard models, and
 regulatory requirements.

Prerequisites:
COMT21002; or DSCI 26010; or CS 33211; or
TECH 23010 and TECH 26301.
Description: Concepts of cloud computing, including storage; services; technology; and management.

Focus is on advanced system components, streamlined operating system installation procedures, and current
 technology in LAN connectivity.

Utilizes digital imaging technologies to produce videos. Includes timelines; filming, importing/exporting video;
 audio; effects, transitions, and captions.

Prerequisites: COMT 11002 or CS 13001 or DSCI 15310 or MIS 24065..
Description:
advanced concepts of Visual Basic: Classes and Objects, Inheritance, Polymorphism, Arrays, Exception
 Handling, Files and Streams, DLLs.

Prerequisites: COMT 11002 or CS 13001 or DSCI 15310 or MIS 24065.
Description:
Using Visual Basic to develop secure, data-aware web applications. Topics covered include HTML and CSS,
 testing and debugging, master pages, state management, security and authentication, SQL and object data
 sources, AJAX, and WCF services.

Prerequisites: COMT 21002 or CS 33211 orDSCI 26010; or TECH 23010 and TECH 26301.
Description:
Course covering installation, configuration, tuning, and communication among state of the art desktop
 operating systems, using available system
tools, utilities and files.

Prerequisites: COMT 21002 or CS 33211 or DSCI 26010; or TECH 23010 and TECH 26301.
Description:
Advanced topics of enterprise network management, including DNS, WINS, IP addressing, routing basics,
 subnet masking, firewalls, storage redundancy techniques, and general tuning, optimizing, troubleshooting,
recovery strategies.
Covers scripting technologies to configure and manage resources and services of LAN servers and workstations.

Prerequisites: COMT 21002 or CS 33211 orDSCI 26010; or TECH 23010 and TECH 26301.
Description: Focus on configuring and administering virtual machine software.

Prerequisites: COMT 21002 or CS 32111 or DSCI 26010; or TECH 23010 and TECH 26301.
Description:
Focus is on the core service roles provided by application services including configuration, maintenance and
 security.

Prerequisites: COMT 21005 or CS 13001 or DSCI 15310or MIS 24065.
Description:
2015 Kent State University Catalog - Spring 2016 Course Descriptions
Focus is on SQL and relational databases using Oracle.

Prerequisites: COMT 21002; orDSCI 26010; or CS 33211; or TECH 23010 and TECH 26301.
Description:
Concepts of cloud forensics, including legal consideration and software tools involved with discovery in the
 cloud.

Focus is on integrating data sources into web sites. Current topics include advanced concepts in server-side
 processing principles, web forms, database programming objects and Structured Query Language.

Course Name: LOCAL AREA NETWORK SECURITY AND FIREWALLS
Description:
Examines the primary issues involved in defining and configuring a local
area network defense perimeter
 including LAN security analysis, implementing firewalls, and intrusion detection systems.

Explores the role and design of databases in organizations, with emphasis on the technologies used in their
 implementation. Emphasis on SQL.
